s26: Second year of the Second Emperor.
s37: Chu Yin Wang Chen Sheng rose in rebellion and entered Qin.
s47: Second. Ge Ying toured Jiujiang for Chen Sheng and established Xiang Qiang as Chu king.
s49: Wu Chen first arrived at Handan, established himself as Zhao king, beginning.
s56: Ninth month. Chu troops arrived at Xi.
s57: Third. Zhou Wen's troops arrived at Xi and were defeated. Ge Ying heard that Chen Sheng had become king and immediately killed Qiang.
s58: Xiang Liang was titled Wu Xin Jun.
s60: Qi King Tian Dan beginning. Dan was a Di tribesman. The various Tian clan honored Qiang. Younger brother Rong, Rong's younger brother Heng.
s61: Pei Gong first rose in rebellion.
s62: Han Guang campaigned for Zhao, reaching Ji, established himself as Yan king, beginning.
s63: Wei King Jiu beginning. Jiu was in Chen and could not return to his state.
s70: Second. Dan rose in rebellion, killed the Di magistrate, and proclaimed himself king.
s71: Second. Attacked Hu Ling and Fang Yu, defeated Qin army supervisors.
s79: Fourth. Li Liang killed Wu Chen, Zhang Er and Chen Yu fled.
s81: Third. Killed the Si Shui magistrate. Took Xishuai. Zhou Shi campaigned east between Feng and Pei.
s83: Third. Qi and Zhao jointly established Zhou Shi, but Shi refused, saying 'We must establish Wei Jiu'.
s91: Fourth. Yong Chi rebelled against Pei Gong, surrendered Feng to Wei. Pei Gong returned to attack Feng but could not take it.
s93: Fourth. Jiu returned from Chen and was established.
s97: Chu King Jing Ke beginning, Qin Jia established him.
s98: Fifth. Chen Sheng's general Zhao Ping falsely appointed Xiang Liang as Chu Zhu Guo and urgently attacked west against Qin.
s99: Zhao King Xie beginning, Zhang Er and Chen Yu established him.
s100: Fifth. Reprimanded Jing Ke for presumptuously becoming king without consulting us.
s101: Fifth. Pei Gong heard Jing Ke was king in Liu, went to join him, and together attacked Qin troops west of Dang.
s103: Fifth. Zhang Han had defeated Chen Sheng and besieged Jiu at Lin Ji.
s108: Sixth. Liang crossed the Jiang, Chen Ying and Qing Bu all joined him.
